review: I have 3 televisions and own 3 boxes including the now discontinued ReView (Google TV), The newest 2012 Apple TV, and The Roku Unit. From a functionality standpoint, the Apple TV is my least favorite.APPLE TVPros: The design, reliability and ease of use and general "fit and finish" is the clear leader of the bunch. Being able to stream some of the content on my Ipad and Iphone is also a cool bonus.CONS:The google TV acts like an Android Phone, you can add apps. Unlike the Google TV, you can not add APPS to the Apple TV and are left with the very limited selection of built-in applications. I can't stream my Amazon Videos, Can't Browse The web, Pandora is not native and the list goes on.  (Unless I am on my Ipad)and the selection is just plain poor.There is no USB port where I can connect an external HD and play media off of it. Both my RoKu and Google TV do this and I use it all the time.I can not connect to my NAS server in the house. Both my RoKu and Google TV instantly see the share and I can stream all the movies and songs that I have on my 3TB master NAS which holds all these things. Although my NAS is an "itunes" server... the only way to stream videos to an Apple TV is to connect to a PC or Mac which is running and logged into Itunes. If I wanted to keep my laptop powered on all the time, this would not be an issue but I don't.In summary, I think the features and functionality of the Apple TV is very limited. It should work like an Iphone or Ipad and support apps just like Google TV does, they should add some USB support and start making NAS products which are compatible with it.
